entry.title: Vuiteboeuf - Baulmes
entry.content: Long run from Vuiteboeuf to Baulmes over the Aiguilles de Baulmes.

entry.title: Via Francigena - from Ponte d'Arbia to San Quirico d'Orcia
entry.content: The 35th leg of the Via Francigena part in Italy. Rather long walk in the Tuscan countryside. Great views on the Val d'Orcia.

entry.title: Via Francigena - from San Quirico d'Orcia to Radicofani
entry.content: The 36th leg of the Via Francigena part in Italy. It's a long, strenuous walk through the Tuscan countryside. Sometimes the walking path is rather close to the main road.

entry.title: Argentario (Tuscany)
entry.content: Hike around the Monte Argentario peninsula in Tuscany. Starting and finishing in Porto Santo Stefano. We visited two beaces: Cala del Gesso and Sassi Verdi. It's very hot and we have to walk a lot on asphalt.

entry.title: Dents de Morcles
entry.content: Dents de Morcles from Ovronnaz

entry.title: Route des Grandes Alpes 2019
entry.content:
Cycling from Lausanne to Nice in eight days.

Prologue: Lausanne - Thonon-les-Bains

Distance: 75km

Etape 1: Thonon-les-Bains - La Clusaz

Etape 2: La Clusaz - Bourg-Saint-Maurice

Etape 3: Bourg Saint Maurice - Saint-Jean-de-Maurienne

Etape 4: Saint Jean de Maurienne - Briançon

Etape 5: Briançon - Jausier

Etape 6: Jausier - Valdeblore

Etape 7: Valdeblore - Villefranche-sur-Mer

entry.content:

  • Time lag: +10.08,9
  • Rank: 46.

entry.title: Lakes around Ivrea
entry.content: Short hike around Lago Pistono and Lago Nero near Ivrea, Italy.

entry.title: Shoulder sling is off
entry.content: Ten days after the injury the sling can be taken off. I start the first out of eight physiotherapy session.

entry.title: Shoulder injury
entry.content: During curling I slipped and dislocated my shoulder. We went to the Morges hospital where they put it back.

entry.title: Pyramides
entry.content: From work to the Pyramides (Place des Cantons) and back through UNIL.

entry.title: Lausanne - Montreux - Grandvaux
entry.content: First ride of the year along the lakeside to Montreux. Back to Vevey, then up to Chexbres and Grandvaux. Finally back to Lausanne through Belmont and Chailly.

entry.title: Skiing in Les Marecottes
entry.content: Two days of skiing in Les Marecottes. Saturday and Sunday morning 3 hour lessons with a ski teacher.

entry.title: Obernai-Mont Sainte-Odlie
entry.content: End of the year hike in Alsace. Start from Obernai towards Bernardswiller and Saint Nabor. There, a steep climb starts to the monastery of Mont Sainte-Odile. We take a short break on the top then head to Otrott, finishing in back in Obernai.

entry.title: Hike around Obernai
entry.content: Hike around the vineyards of Obernai.

entry.content: Up to Savuvabelin through Avenue de Grey then back crossing La Sallaz and down on Rue de Vallon.

entry.content: Up to Savuvabelin through Avenue de Grey then back crossing Riponne and Rue de Valentin.

entry.content: From work to the Pyramides (Place des Cantons) and back through UNIL.

entry.title: La Sarraz - Bretonnières
entry.content: Winter hike from La Sarraz to Bretonnières along the Venoge. Coffee and cake in Romanmôtier.

entry.content: Long run from canton Vaud to canton Fribourg with a lot of elevation gain.

entry.title: Riponne - Chalet-à-Gobet
entry.content: Evening run from the center of Lausanne to Chalet-à-Gobet.

entry.title: Daily back excercises
entry.content:
A series of back excercises to do daily:

  1. Neck tuck
  2. Head back extension (use towel)
  3. Arms lock back stretch (expands chest)
  4. Squeeze shoulder blades
  5. Back extension (push up position)
  6. Hip flex (kneeling with one leg bent)
  7. Ham string stretch

Source: Youtube

entry.title: Nyon - Chalet de la Dôle - St. Cergue
entry.content: From Nyon follow the hiking trail No. 5 (Sentier des crêtes). First 7 km is flat/slighly up, then steep clim to the Chalet de la Dôle. The last couple of kilometers down to St. Cergue is easy.
